metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2037 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The cpio_safer_name_suffix function in util.c in cpio 2.11 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) via a crafted cpio file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2037` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpio - 2.11+dfsg-5ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> test case attached to oss-security email

criterions.comment: cpio package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.11+dfsg-5ubuntu1').
